sentence: We expect the world's largest home improvement retailer Home Depot Inc. ( HD ) to beat expectations when it reports fourth-quarter fiscal 2014 results on Feb 24, before the market opens.
Our proven model shows that Home Depot may beat earnings because it has the right combination of two key components.
Positive Zacks ESP: Home Depot currently has an Earnings ESP of +1.12%.
This is because the Most Accurate estimate stands at 90 cents per share, while the Zacks Consensus Estimate is pegged at 89 cents.
Zacks Rank #3 (Hold): Note that stocks with a Zacks Rank #1, 2 and 3 have a higher chance of beating earnings.
The Sell-rated stocks (#4 and 5) should never be considered going into an earnings announcement.
The combination of Home Depot's Zacks Rank #3 and Earnings ESP of +1.12% makes us confident of a positive earnings beat.

Being the world's largest home improvement retailer, we believe that Home Depot is well positioned to benefit from the gradually recovering housing market and expect the company to continue with its upbeat performance going forward.
After an encouraging third quarter, the company is optimistic about its fourth-quarter performance.
Moreover, the company expects to continue gaining from the share repurchases made in the fourth quarter.
Home Depot has topped the Zacks Consensus Estimate in the trailing four quarters with an average positive surprise of 3.4%.
In the last concluded quarter, the company beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.13 by 1.8%.

Other Stocks to Consider

Home Depot is not the only firm looking up this earnings season.

The following companies are also likely to beat earnings in the to-be-reported quarter:

Lowe's Companies Inc. ( LOW ) has an Earnings ESP of +2.27% and a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
Kroger Co. ( KR ) has an Earnings ESP of +4.49% and a Zacks Rank #2.
Kohl's Corp. ( KSS ) has an Earnings ESP of +0.56% and a Zacks Rank #2.
